{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Electrical Engineer (Panel Builder)",
  "description": "Mikano International is Nigerian company in the power generation, automobile, steel fabrication sectors. This company offers sales, maintenance, assembly and distribution of power generation products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer (Panel Builder)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	An experienced electrical Engineer (Panel Builder) who be responsible for designing, assembling, wiring, and testing electrical control panels used in industrial and commercial applications.
	The role ensures panels are built according to engineering drawings, safety standards, and client specifications while maintaining high-quality workmanship and compliance with electrical codes.


Key Responsibilities
Design &amp; Technical Work:


	Interpret electrical drawings, wiring diagrams, schematics, and layout designs for panel construction.
	Design control panel layouts, component placement, and wiring pathways.
	Select appropriate components such as contractors, relays, circuit breakers, switches, PLCs, and VFDs.
	Ensure all panel designs meet industry standards (IEC, NEC, etc.) and client requirements.


Panel Assembly &amp; Wiring:


	Assemble electrical control panels, mounting components, and labeling terminals.
	Perform wiring of control panels according to engineering drawings and best practices.
	Ensure proper cable routing, termination, and connection.
	Maintain high-quality workmanship with attention to detail and safety


Testing &amp; Quality Assurance:


	Conduct functional testing of panels (continuity checks, insulation tests, component testing).
	Troubleshoot and resolve wiring or component issues during testing.
	Verify compliance with safety regulations and internal quality standards.


Documentation &amp; Reporting:


	Update wiring diagrams when modifications are made during assembly.
	Prepare testing reports, material usage records, and quality documentation.
	Provide technical input for bill of materials (BOM) preparation.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or OND/HND in Electrical Engineering, Electromechanical Engineering, or related field.
	Proven experience in electrical panel building or industrial control systems.
	Strong understanding of control circuits, power distribution, PLCs, and automation components.
	Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and electrical schematics.
	Hands-on experience with wiring tools, testing equipment, and panel assembly processes.
	Knowledge of relevant electrical standards and safety codes.
	Good troubleshooting skills and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Technical accuracy
	Problem-solving and analytical skills
	Strong attention to detail
	Time management
	Teamwork and communication
	Adherence to safety protocols.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CVs to:&nbsp;careers@mikano-intl.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-25",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mikano"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190904"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Electrical Engineer (Panel Builder) Job at Mikano International




        
    

        
        Mikano International is Nigerian company in the power generation, automobile, steel fabrication sectors. This company offers sales, maintenance, assembly and distribution of power generation products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer (Panel Builder)

Job Location: Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	An experienced electrical Engineer (Panel Builder) who be responsible for designing, assembling, wiring, and testing electrical control panels used in industrial and commercial applications.
	The role ensures panels are built according to engineering drawings, safety standards, and client specifications while maintaining high-quality workmanship and compliance with electrical codes.


Key Responsibilities
Design & Technical Work:


	Interpret electrical drawings, wiring diagrams, schematics, and layout designs for panel construction.
	Design control panel layouts, component placement, and wiring pathways.
	Select appropriate components such as contractors, relays, circuit breakers, switches, PLCs, and VFDs.
	Ensure all panel designs meet industry standards (IEC, NEC, etc.) and client requirements.


Panel Assembly & Wiring:


	Assemble electrical control panels, mounting components, and labeling terminals.
	Perform wiring of control panels according to engineering drawings and best practices.
	Ensure proper cable routing, termination, and connection.
	Maintain high-quality workmanship with attention to detail and safety


Testing & Quality Assurance:


	Conduct functional testing of panels (continuity checks, insulation tests, component testing).
	Troubleshoot and resolve wiring or component issues during testing.
	Verify compliance with safety regulations and internal quality standards.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Update wiring diagrams when modifications are made during assembly.
	Prepare testing reports, material usage records, and quality documentation.
	Provide technical input for bill of materials (BOM) preparation.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree or OND/HND in Electrical Engineering, Electromechanical Engineering, or related field.
	Proven experience in electrical panel building or industrial control systems.
	Strong understanding of control circuits, power distribution, PLCs, and automation components.
	Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and electrical schematics.
	Hands-on experience with wiring tools, testing equipment, and panel assembly processes.
	Knowledge of relevant electrical standards and safety codes.
	Good troubleshooting skills and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Technical accuracy
	Problem-solving and analytical skills
	Strong attention to detail
	Time management
	Teamwork and communication
	Adherence to safety protocols.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CVs to: careers@mikano-intl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "Hedmee Group of Companies&nbsp;is a Nigerian powerhouse with diversified interests in security printing, agribusiness, education consulting, construction, and petroleum.&nbsp;We are driven by excellence, innovation, and integrity &mdash; delivering solutions that impact industries, empower communities, and shape the future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos (Hybrid)

Key Responsibilities


	Design visuals for social media, websites, and marketing campaigns
	Create flyers, brochures, banners, and brand materials
	Ensure consistency with our visual identity
	Translate ideas into high-quality designs


Requirements


	2&ndash;3 years of experience in graphic design
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite or CorelDRAW
	Strong and verifiable design portfolio
	Excellent creativity, attention to detail, and time-management skills.


Remuneration
N150,000 &ndash; N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to:&nbsp;hr@hedmee.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;the Job Position as&nbsp;the subject of the mail.",

Graphics Designer Job at Hedmee Group of Companies




        
    

        
        Hedmee Group of Companies is a Nigerian powerhouse with diversified interests in security printing, agribusiness, education consulting, construction, and petroleum. We are driven by excellence, innovation, and integrity — delivering solutions that impact industries, empower communities, and shape the future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer 

Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos (Hybrid)

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design visuals for social media, websites, and marketing campaigns
	Create flyers, brochures, banners, and brand materials
	Ensure consistency with our visual identity
	Translate ideas into high-quality designs


Requirements


	2–3 years of experience in graphic design
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite or CorelDRAW
	Strong and verifiable design portfolio
	Excellent creativity, attention to detail, and time-management skills.


Remuneration
N150,000 – N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: hr@hedmee.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Market Developer",
  "description": "Trustlub Fluid Resources Limited is an indigenous company that engages in the production and distribution of Trustlub brand of lubricants, supply of fuels, associated lubrication engineering, importation of base oil, additives, grease and provision of customer support services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Market Developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Roles And Responsibilities


	To market and sell the company&rsquo;s image and product to current, new and potential customers with a view to achieving set targets.
	To interface between the company and the customers for efficient service delivery.
	To achieve a monthly sales target and equivalent collections in litres.
	To prepare invoices and submit same to customers upon delivery of products.
	To organise and engage in marketing activities e.g. market storms, mechanic meets etc.
	To effectively cover and manage assigned territory.
	To submit accurate weekly sales performance reports.
	To prepare and submit monthly sales performance reports.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in any field.
	3 - 5 years of cognate experience in the sales and marketing of Lubricants or FMCG products with strength in market storm, market activation, product canvassing.
	Ability to drive and in possession of a valid Nigerian driver`s license.
	Attention to detail.
	Target Oriented.
	Familiar with Lagos road networks.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitments@trustlubfluid.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Market Developer Job at Trustlub Fluid Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Trustlub Fluid Resources Limited is an indigenous company that engages in the production and distribution of Trustlub brand of lubricants, supply of fuels, associated lubrication engineering, importation of base oil, additives, grease and provision of customer support services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Market Developer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Roles And Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To market and sell the company’s image and product to current, new and potential customers with a view to achieving set targets.
	To interface between the company and the customers for efficient service delivery.
	To achieve a monthly sales target and equivalent collections in litres.
	To prepare invoices and submit same to customers upon delivery of products.
	To organise and engage in marketing activities e.g. market storms, mechanic meets etc.
	To effectively cover and manage assigned territory.
	To submit accurate weekly sales performance reports.
	To prepare and submit monthly sales performance reports.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in any field.
	3 - 5 years of cognate experience in the sales and marketing of Lubricants or FMCG products with strength in market storm, market activation, product canvassing.
	Ability to drive and in possession of a valid Nigerian driver`s license.
	Attention to detail.
	Target Oriented.
	Familiar with Lagos road networks.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@trustlubfluid.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
